Looks like `Basic Tests Multi-language Linux` has a flake somewhere that hits a segfault intermittently on Python 2.7, usually (but also during other tests) during `py27_native.test.unit._channel_ready_future_test.ChannelReadyFutureTest`.

The failure has already occurred several times on master in the last few days, but it looks like the changes here might have made it more frequent. I think it may be a bug in our test suite (since it only started segfaulting on this PR after I added the new tests, but it's not the new tests that are failing), diagnosing now.

This is https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/15308 - although it can also occassionally segfault during a different test, e.g., `MetadataCodeDetailsTest` [here](https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/85b25761-2739-4bd0-900f-65d8f25e0896/targets/github%2Fgrpc%2Fpython_linux_opt_native/tests)

Forward the critical log segment in the failed test:
```
TIMEOUT: //src/python/grpcio_tests/tests/unit:_server_shutdown_test (Summary)
      /root/.cache/bazel/_bazel_root/d2dc70c3d9da3fab488ba0dcbbd35051/execroot/com_github_grpc_grpc/bazel-out/k8-fastbuild/testlogs/src/python/grpcio_tests/tests/unit/_server_shutdown_test/test.log
==================== Test output for //src/python/grpcio_tests/tests/unit:_server_shutdown_test:
test_deallocated_server_stops (__main__.ServerShutdown) ... ok
test_server_exception_exits (__main__.ServerShutdown) ... Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/var/local/git/grpc/src/python/grpcio_tests/tests/unit/_server_shutdown_scenarios.py", line 97, in <module>
    run_test(args)
  File "/var/local/git/grpc/src/python/grpcio_tests/tests/unit/_server_shutdown_scenarios.py", line 71, in run_test
    raise Exception()
Exception
ok
test_server_fork_can_exit (__main__.ServerShutdown) ... Terminated
external/bazel_tools/tools/test/test-setup.sh: line 193:  6696 Terminated              ( "${TEST_PATH}" "$@" &> "${XML_OUTPUT_FILE}.log" )
================================================================================
```

Bazel failure was due to our (rather old) bazel docker image not supporting ipv6. This + wait_for_ready=True means that the test was timing out while the channel attempted and repeatedly failed to connect with the error:

```
"Connect Failed","file":"src/core/ext/filters/
client_channel/subchannel.cc","file_line":867,"grpc_status":14,"referenced_errors":[{"created":"@1545109177.781701379","de
scription":"OS Error","errno":97,"file":"src/core/lib/iomgr/socket_utils_common_posix.cc","file_line":379,"os_error":"Address family not supported by protocol","syscall":"socket","target_address":"[::]:43403"}]}]}]
```
